intro: Beloperone involucrata var. microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are small, narrow, and densely arranged, giving it a compact appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive blooms and resilience in various environmental conditions.
